definitions: A person or thing that is on the border or edge of something.
A person who is not part of the mainstream or who is considered to be outside the norm.
A small or insignificant amount or degree of something.
examples: The artist lived as a marginal, creating unique but unrecognized works.
The new policy only made a marginal difference to the overall budget.
He was a marginal in the academic community, often challenging established theories.
